name: ðŸŸ 601 Communicates with all asset services connected to the transporter.
info:
6)	Communicate: A total integrated networked environment is one of the I4.0 pillars. 
Creating I4.0 applications in the Produce part requires a standardized and automatic communication among assets.
The sixth step in the Produce process, involves utilizing service composer software compatible with the asset communication protocol and their respective information models of the PnPr architecture to establish a communication channel for creating automation applications. 
In our proposal, Node-RED was chosen as the composer due to its industry acceptance and communication support for our PnPr architecture (microservice, OPC UA and HTTP).

name: Description produce
format: Our proposal of the Produce part of the PnPr architecture is presented in Fig.. At the top, in the green rectangle with dashed line, are the (5) steps of Produce, which can be interpreted from left to right: communicate (6), select (7), analyze (8), compose (9) and manage (10). At the bottom of the green rectangle with dashed line in Fig., the number of steps is associated with their specific functions in the PnPr architecture, maintaining the same numbering.

Description of registry
info:
Registry â€“ A centralized storage object that holds dynamic variables, configurations, and other essential application data. 
It serves as a single source of truth for managing runtime settings, environment parameters, and metadata, allowing seamless access and updates across different components of the application. 
The Registry ensures consistency, flexibility, and maintainability by providing a structured way to store and retrieve critical information.

};


return msg;

Description communicate
format:
A total integrated networked environment is one of the I4.0 pillars. Creating I4.0 applications in the Produce part requires a standardized and automatic communication among assets.

The sixth step in the Produce process, as depicted in Fig. (6), involves utilizing service composer software compatible with the asset communication protocol and their respective information models of the PnPr architecture to establish a communication channel for creating automation applications.

In our proposal, Node-RED and the 4diac IDE for IEC 61499 were chosen as the composers due to their industry acceptance and communication support for our PnPr architecture (microservice, OPC UA, and HTTP).

name: Description select
format:
The seventh step in the Produce process, as illustrated in Fig. (7) (green rectangle), involves application composers issuing a scanner request to detect all assets present in the network.

Upon receiving a response, which includes their properties, capacities, and other structured information according to the information model (AAS), the data can be organized into an Asset Library, as depicted in Fig. (7).

In our proposal, we use the Node Package Manager (NPM) and 4diac for encapsulating and distributing custom-created libraries and/or blocks within the Node-RED and IEC61499 development environments.

name: Description analyze
format:
In the eighth step in Produce in Fig. (8) (green rectangle), the compositor analyzes the identity, functionalities, and requirements of the asset(s).

The asset manager data structure in Fig. (8) (E.g., Motor) supports the representation of the physical and the information world, allowing the change of asset parameters, as well as the creation of asset simulation models for enabling the creation of Digital Twins (DT).

name: Description compose
format:
Industrial service-oriented applications mostly rely on the orchestration procedure. The ninth step in Produce in Fig. (9) (green rectangle) is related to the composition of applications in the PnPr architecture.

As in an "orchestra", the composer defines a sequence in which the assets will relate, composing the required application in Fig. (9) (Asset Composer).

name: Description manage
format:
The tenth and last step in Produce in Fig. (10) (green rectangle) occurs after defining the order in the assetâ€™s composition. The execution of the application can occur manually, where each step of the program is controlled and initiated by the user.

Furthermore, there is automatic execution, where the program is configured to operate autonomously, without direct user intervention. Actions are performed according to a set of predefined instructions or rules.
